Description: Buffer overflow in \texttt{insert_many} allows writing elements past a vector's size.
\texttt{MappedMutexGuard} can cause data races, violating Rust memory safety garauntees in multi-threaded applications.

Multiple RAII objects used to represent acquired locks allow for data races. Types that should be accessible only on one thread at a time are allowed to be used concurrently leading to violations of Rust's memory safety garauntees.
The \texttt{load} method has incorrect assumptions about lifetimes leading to reading from a dangling pointer.
Overflow in \texttt{insert_many}, from authors copying smallvec code.
\texttt{TreeFocus}, an iterator over trees structures can enable data races.
\texttt{Error} drops objects without ownership leading to use-after-free.
\texttt{Generator}s can be sent across threads leading to data races.
\texttt{Content} passes uninitialized memory to safe functions.
\texttt{read_spv} returns uninitialized bytes when reading incompletely .
\texttt{Atom<T>} can be instantiated with any \texttt{T} allowing data races for non thread safe types when used concurrently.
\texttt{Shared} bypasses concurrency safety without being marked \texttt{unsafe}.
\texttt{metadata::read} methods return unitialized memory.
\texttt{read_spirv} passes unitialized memory to safe Rust.
\texttt{GenericMutexGuard}, an RAII object representing an acquired \texttt{Mutex} lock allow for data races.
\texttt{read_framed_max} passes unitialized memory to safe Rust.
\texttt{get} trusts the size in a CFB header, exposing uninitialized data.
\texttt{AtomicOption} allows data races with non-thread safe types.
\texttt{map_array} can double-drop elements if the map function panics.
\texttt{Cow} allows usage of non-thread safe types concurrently.
\texttt{TensorType} allows memory unsafe operations but is not \texttt{unsafe}.
The \texttt{Device} trait lacks \texttt{Send} and \texttt{Sync} bounds.
\texttt{EventList} can double-drop elements when \texttt{Into} panics.
\texttt{CopyCell} allows data races with non-\texttt{Send} but \texttt{Copy}able types.
\texttt{AtomicBox} allows data races with non-thread safe types.
\texttt{OnceCell} lacks a `Send` bound allowing for data races.
\texttt{Decoder}s can be sent across threads racing their reader objects.
\texttt{Store}s are assumed to be thread-safe violating concurrency safety.
\texttt{Queue}s can send non-thread safe objects across thread boundaries.
\texttt{Hashable} types are assumed to always be thread-safe.
Violates rust aliasing rules by creating multiple mutable references.
RAII objects for acquired locks allow for data races.
\texttt{ReaderResult} allows data races with non-thread safe types.
\texttt{Input} types are assumed to always be thread-safe.
